action.action-desc: Mr. Harrigan introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to authorize the use of National Guard forces for immigration enforcement purposes, to establish criminal penalties for assaulting immigration enforcement officers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Guarding U.S. Authority for Removal and Detention Act or the GUARD Act.

section.header: Amendment to the posse comitatus act
section.text: Section 1385 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Whoever and inserting (a) Whoever; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Subsection (a) shall not apply to the use of members of the National Guard—

paragraph.text: performing State duty under orders issued by the Governor of such State; or
performing duty under title 10 or 32, if such members are used exclusively for—

subparagraph.text: the enforcement of the immigration laws (as such term is defined in section 101 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C.1101)), including the apprehension or detention of aliens unlawfully present in the United States, and the execution of orders of removal issued under the immigration laws; or

subsection.header: Assault on Federal Immigration Officers or State Law Enforcement Assisting Immigration Operations
subsection.text: Chapter 7 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
Whoever knowingly assaults, resists, opposes, impedes, intimidates, or interferes with—

paragraph.text: any officer or employee of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, U.S. Customs and Border Protection, or any other Federal immigration enforcement agency; or

any State or local law enforcement officer acting under Federal authority or in active assistance of Federal immigration enforcement operations in the performance of their official duties, or on account of the performance of such duties,

subsection.continuation-text: shall be fined under this title and imprisoned not less than 5 years and not more than 20 years.

subsection.text: If bodily injury results from the acts committed in violation of subsection (a), the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 10 years and not more than 30 years.
If death results from the acts committed in violation of subsection (a), the offender shall be subject to imprisonment for life or the death penalty.
